summary: This document is a chain of emails between federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and defense attorneys from Winston & Strawn LLP, primarily Suzanne Jaffe Bloom, regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss a grand jury subpoena issued to an unnamed client (referred to as 'Ms. [REDACTED]'). The emails discuss postponing the client's grand jury appearance, sharing evidence like threatening communications and phone records, and negotiating a potential voluntary interview.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Defense Attorney, Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Lead defense attorney representing an unnamed female client who received a grand jury subpoena. She is coordinating with SDNY prosecutors to schedule meetings, discuss evidence, and negotiate terms for her client's cooperation.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney working with Suzanne Bloom on the defense team. She is copied on emails and involved in scheduling the meeting with prosecutors.

persons.name: Cristina I. Calvar
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email chain, part of the defense legal team.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of an unnamed client.
Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP, as Calvar is consistently copied on team emails.

Bloom, as defense counsel, is in communication with SDNY prosecutors to schedule meetings, discuss evidence (threats, phone records), and negotiate the terms of her client's potential cooperation and grand jury appearance.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to an unnamed female client ('Ms. [REDACTED]').

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The initial date the subpoenaed client was required to appear before the grand jury. This date was adjourned/held in abeyance following discussions between defense and prosecution.

events.title: Scheduling of Attorney Proffer Meeting
events.description: Extended email negotiations to schedule a meeting between defense attorneys (Bloom, Hudgens) and SDNY prosecutors to continue discussions and a potential attorney proffer regarding the client.

events.title: Phone Call Regarding Threats
events.description: A phone call between defense attorney Suzanne Bloom and SDNY prosecutors where Bloom intended to share information about threatening communications received by her client's husband.

locations: Florida (mentioned as a travel destination for attorneys)
Bogota (mentioned as a travel destination for an attorney)
keyFacts: The document centers on a grand jury subpoena issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an unnamed female client represented by Winston & Strawn LLP.
Prosecutors revealed they possess contemporaneous cell phone records registered to the client showing "numerous phone contacts with multiple girls who were underage at the time of the calls."
The defense attorney, Suzanne Bloom, informed prosecutors that her client's husband had received threatening communications, which she offered to share.
The original grand jury appearance date of July 24, 2019, was held in abeyance while the parties discussed a potential voluntary interview and proffer agreement.
The email chain is heavily redacted, concealing the names of the SDNY prosecutors, the client, and the client's husband, indicating the sensitivity of the ongoing investigation.
